sense.gloss: to permit, to allow, to approve, to consent to
to forgive, to pardon, to excuse, to tolerate
to exempt (someone) from, to remit, to release, to let off
to trust, to confide in, to let one's guard down
to give up (points in a game, distance in a race, etc.), to yield

sdata.e: If you have the time you are welcome to make use of and contribute to the Tatoeba project.

sdata.j: ↑人↑↓ひと↓を|↑許↑↓ゆる↓す|ことを↑覚↑↓おぼ↓え、↑身↑↓み↓につけなければいけません。|↑許↑↓ゆる↓す|↑力量↑↓りきりょう↓のない↑者↑↓もの↓には、↑愛↑↓あい↓する↑力↑↓ちから↓もありません。↑最悪↑↓さいあく↓の↑人間↑↓にんげん↓にもどこか↑取↑↓と↓り↑柄↑↓え↓があるように、↑最高↑↓さいこう↓の↑人間↑↓にんげん↓にも↑悪↑↓わる↓い↑面↑↓めん↓はあります。これがわかれば、↑敵↑↓てき↓を↑憎↑↓にく↓む↑気持↑↓きも↓ちが↑薄↑↓うす↓れます。
sdata.e: We must develop and maintain the capacity to forgive. He who is devoid of the power to forgive is devoid of the power to love. There is some good in the worst of us and some evil in the best of us. When we discover this, we are less prone to hate our enemies.

sdata.j: お↑客様↑↓きゃくさま↓を↑脅迫↑↓きょうはく↓して↑契約↑↓けいやく↓をサインさせるとは、↑銀行員↑↓ぎんこういん↓として|↑許↑↓ゆる↓す|べからざる↑行為↑↓こうい↓である。
sdata.e: Forcing customers to sign a contract by using threats is an unforgivable act as a bank employee.
